results.title: [Churchill Island]
results.brief_description: No title or credits available. An overview of the history of Churchill Island which was purchased by the Victoria Conservation Trust in January 1976 to be kept for the people of Victoria. It is a small island in size, yet large in both historical and conservation significance. Situated in Westernport Bay near Phillip Island, Churchill Island was first discovered on 5th January, 1798 by George Bass. A detailed booklet accompanies this film.

results.title: Shah of Iran
results.brief_description: Presents an interview with the Shah and his wife in 1975 interspersed with footage of siginificant events during his regime. Series: “The Chalfont Profiles”.

results.title: The Rabbit in Australia
results.brief_description: The introduction of the rabbit into Australia and the resultant long battle to contol it. Notes how the rabbit feeds, breeds and survives in different parts of Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: The Dawn of motoring
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, John Wiles, British Petroleum and Films of Today
results.brief_description: Part one of a 6-part series “History of the motor car”. Covers the development of the motorcar from the invention of the wheel to 1895 when the first cars produced in commercial quantities appeared on the roads.

results.title: The Tap dance kid. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: Barra Grant, Evelyn Barron and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Eight year old Willie Sheridan has a single passion - dancing. His twelve-year-old sister Emma wants to be a lawyer. When Willie, with Emma’s help, gets a chance to audition for summer stock, the entire family confronts the conflict between parents wishes and children’s dreams.
Edited version based on the book “Nobody’s family is going to change” by Louise Fitzhugh.

results.title: Big Henry and the polka dot kid
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Linda Gottlieb and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the novel ‘Luke Baldwin’s Vow’ by Morley Callaghan, about a ten year old orphan boy who goes to live with his aunt and uncle in rural Canada. Shows how the boy’s love for an old blind dog leads to conflict with his uncle who feels that the animal is impractical to keep.

results.title: Why we conserve energy: the witch of the Great Black Pool
results.creator_credit: Maureen Selwood and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Uses an animated allegory about the Land of the Scatterpods whose inhabitants love machines to emphasize the importance of energy conservation and utilization of solar, water and wind energy. Story by Marie Winn Miller. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Egypt: the struggle for stability
results.creator_credit: Antony Thomas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Part of “The Arab Experience” series, this episode explains that Egypt is a study in contrast and conflict, a land of both water wheels and massive hydro-electric power facilities. It is a country with great potential in its natural resources and a level of poverty among the worst in the world.
